title: Sort of similar to Braggadocio...
content:
Hello Typophiles,

Any help identifying this font would be much appreciated.

Many thanks,

Rachel

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [CH-Modified-Tee-WHITE.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010053/http:/typophile.com/files/CH-Modified-Tee-WHITE.jpg) | 12.98 KB |
author: Rachel C

comments.content: ...or a suggestion of a similar font.

Take a look at these fat fonts:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/42643](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010053/http:/typophile.com/node/42643 "http://typophile.com/node/42643")

I have the feeling that’s an handmade illustration. However, searching for “fat” at MyFonts could give you some interesting alternatives.  
For the N: [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/subcommunications/subelek/heavy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010053/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/subcommunications/subelek/heavy/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/subcommunications/subelek/heavy/")  
For the E: [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/grafinc/extra-black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010053/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/grafinc/extra-black/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/grafinc/extra-black/")

Yes, I forgot that thread.  
Definitely N and E from Baby Teeth/Fatti Patti. The K seems custom.

Special-K, riccard0 - thank you very much.

I'm still getting to grips on what key words to use when I search for fonts.
